page.title: 07FRENCH INVASION
page.content: In the year 1797 the French sent an invasion force to Britain. The French were heading towards Bristol, but strong winds took them off course. They landed in Carreg Wastad Bay on the Pembrokeshire coast. They marched inland. The first farm they came to was Trehowel. They took over Trehowel and made it their strong_hold. Then they marched on to Brestgarn. They raided Llanwnda village and one of the prisoners stole the church plate. They stormed St. Nicholas village but did not go much further south. At Trehowl the French commander who was an American soldier called Tate decided to surrender. They surrendered at Goodwick beach and they signed a peace treaty at the Royal Oak
